data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code, to make consequential amendments to other Acts and to repeal a regulation (miscarriage of justice reviews)
data.header: The Miscarriage of Justice Review Commission Act aims to improve the investigation of wrongful convictions in Canada by creating an independent body, promoting fairness in the justice system.
data.shortTitle: Miscarriage of Justice Review Commission Act (David and Joyce Milgaard's Law)

data.title: An Act for granting to His Majesty certain sums of money for the federal public administration for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2025
data.header: Bill C-79 proposes a significant allocation of over $21 billion to enhance various government services, impacting employees, taxpayers, and vulnerable communities. Supporters highlight its importance for stability, while critics warn of potential financial risks.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Wild Animal and Plant Protection and Regulation of International and Interprovincial Trade Act
data.header: This bill aims to enhance regulations on the captivity of elephants and great apes, ensuring better management and welfare through new reporting and compliance requirements.
data.shortTitle: Stronger Protections for Elephants and Apes
data.status: Senate bill awaiting first reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Corrections and Conditional Release Act (disclosure of information to victims)
data.header: This proposed amendment aims to enhance transparency in the corrections process by ensuring victims receive timely updates on offenders’ parole eligibility, potentially giving them a greater sense of involvement and security.
data.status: At third reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act respecting Ukrainian Heritage Month
data.header: The Ukrainian Heritage Month Act aims to celebrate and recognize the contributions of Ukrainian Canadians, fostering community pride and cultural diversity in Canada.
data.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act respecting temporary cost of living relief (affordability)
data.header: The Tax Break for All Canadians Act aims to boost holiday shopping by temporarily removing sales taxes on certain items, helping families enjoy the season while raising concerns about potential impacts on government services and income inequality.
data.shortTitle: Tax Break for All Canadians Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act and the Companies’ Creditors Arrangement Act (deemed trust – perishable fruits and vegetables)
data.header: This act aims to safeguard farmers and suppliers of fresh produce by ensuring their payments are prioritized in case of bankruptcy, helping to sustain small agricultural businesses in tough times.
data.shortTitle: Financial Protection for Fresh Fruit and Vegetable Farmers Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Citizenship Act (2024)
data.header: This proposed change to the Citizenship Act aims to make it easier for Canadians abroad and those affected by past issues to gain or regain citizenship, fostering inclusivity and addressing historical injustices.
data.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act amending the Canada Labour Code (complaints by former employees)
data.header: A new amendment aims to help former employees report workplace harassment and violence, giving them more time to seek justice after leaving their jobs.
data.status: At report stage in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Corrections and Conditional Release Act
data.header: Tona's Law aims to reform the corrections system by enhancing mental health care for inmates and promoting fair sentencing practices. It proposes important changes, like mental health assessments and limiting isolation, but also raises concerns about costs and public safety.
data.shortTitle: Providing Alternatives to Isolation and Ensuring Oversight and Remedies in the Correctional System Act (Tona’s Law)
data.status: Senate bill awaiting first reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (assaults against persons who provide health services and first responders)
data.header: This amendment aims to enhance the protection of healthcare workers and first responders by introducing stricter penalties for assaults against them, sparking debate on its impact on fairness in the judicial system.
data.status: At third reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act to amend the Parliament of Canada Act (need to know)
data.header: A proposed amendment aims to simplify how Canadian parliamentarians access sensitive information, but raises concerns about security and accountability.
data.status: At report stage in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (coercive control of intimate partner)
data.header: A new amendment in the Criminal Code aims to address coercive control in relationships by defining and criminalizing harmful behaviors that affect victims' safety and autonomy. This step could transform how domestic violence cases are handled, providing victims with legal protections while raising concerns about potential misuse.
data.status: At consideration in committee in the Senate

data.title: An Act respecting cyber security, amending the Telecommunications Act and making consequential amendments to other Acts
data.header: The Cyber Security Act aims to bolster Canada's telecommunications security by enforcing stricter regulations and protecting essential systems from cyber threats, but it raises important questions regarding privacy and compliance for service providers.
data.status: At consideration in the House of Commons of amendments made by the Senate

data.title: An Act to amend the Health of Animals Act (biosecurity on farms)
data.header: A new amendment aims to protect animal health through strict regulations, but it may create financial burdens for farmers and veterinarians while raising concerns about its broad interpretations.
data.status: At third reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Disability Benefit Act
data.header: A new amendment to the Canada Disability Benefit Act could make it easier for individuals with disabilities to qualify for benefits by eliminating restrictions based on household income and marital status.

data.title: An Act respecting water, source water, drinking water, wastewater and related infrastructure on First Nation lands
data.header: The First Nations Clean Water Act empowers Indigenous communities to manage their own water resources, aiming to ensure access to safe drinking water and improve public health while addressing historical inequalities.
data.status: At report stage in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Food and Drugs Act (natural health products)
data.header: Proposed amendments to the Food and Drugs Act aim to ease regulations on natural health products, potentially increasing availability and lowering prices, but raising concerns about public safety and health risks.
data.status: At report stage in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Food and Drugs Act (prohibition of food and beverage marketing directed at children)
data.header: The Child Health Protection Act aims to limit unhealthy food marketing to children under 13, seeking to improve their dietary habits and health while presenting challenges for food manufacturers, especially smaller businesses.
data.status: At third reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act to establish a national food cooperative strategy
data.header: The National Food Cooperative Strategy Act aims to boost competition and sustainability in Canada's grocery sector, benefiting consumers and local producers while raising concerns about government funding and resource allocation.

data.title: An Act to amend the Interpretation Act and to make related amendments to other Acts
data.header: This bill aims to amend laws to better protect the rights of Indigenous peoples, ensuring their governance aligns with constitutional frameworks while raising some economic concerns for resource-dependent industries.

data.title: An Act respecting national action for the prevention of intimate partner violence
data.header: Georgina's Law is set to tackle intimate partner violence by creating a national strategy involving collaboration among various levels of government and stakeholders, including Indigenous partners, to ensure comprehensive support and accountability for victims.
data.status: Senate bill awaiting first reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (criminal organizations and proceeds of crime)
data.header: The proposed changes to the Criminal Code focus on toughening laws against organized crime, making it harder for criminals to keep their assets. This could impact innocent property owners, especially those from marginalized communities, raising concerns about fairness and due process.

data.title: An Act to establish a national strategy for universal eye care
data.header: The National Strategy for Universal Eye Care Act aims to enhance access to eye care services across Canada, especially for marginalized groups, promoting better health and quality of life.
data.shortTitle: National Strategy for Universal Eye Care Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (pornographic material)
data.header: The Stopping Internet Sexual Exploitation Act aims to tighten regulations on the adult entertainment industry, imposing hefty age verification and consent requirements. While intended to protect vulnerable populations, many worry it could unfairly burden legitimate creators.
data.status: At report stage in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Copyright Act (diagnosis, maintenance and repair)
data.header: Proposed changes to the Copyright Act could make it easier for consumers and repair technicians to fix products by bypassing some digital barriers. While this aims to lower costs and enhance sustainability, it also raises concerns about the impact on copyright protections and creative industries.

data.title: An Act to amend the Copyright Act (interoperability)
data.header: Proposed amendments to the Copyright Act aim to enhance compatibility between software and devices, which could spark innovation while raising concerns about piracy and developer protections.

data.title: An Act respecting the recognition of the Haida Nation and the Council of the Haida Nation
data.header: The Haida Nation Recognition Act enhances self-governance for the Haida people, allowing them to better manage their resources and uphold their cultural practices, while also raising questions about financial sustainability and accountability.

data.title: An Act to establish a national strategy for eye care
data.header: The National Strategy for Eye Care Act aims to significantly enhance eye health in Canada through better training for healthcare providers and improved prevention and treatment of eye diseases.
data.shortTitle: National Strategy for Eye Care Act

data.title: An Act to establish National Thanadelthur Day
data.header: The National Thanadelthur Day Act establishes February 5th to celebrate an important indigenous figure in Canadian history, encouraging cultural awareness and appreciation, yet lacking mandatory observance. Supporters see potential economic benefits, while critics question its practical impact.
data.status: At consideration in committee in the Senate

data.title: An Act to amend the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Act (supply management)
data.header: Bill C-282 seeks to protect Canadian farmers by restricting trade agreements that could impact the tariffs on supply-managed goods like dairy and poultry. This means stable prices for producers but potential higher costs for consumers.
data.status: At report stage in the Senate

data.title: An Act respecting a national framework on advertising for sports betting
data.header: The National Framework on Advertising for Sports Betting Act aims to protect vulnerable populations by regulating how sports betting is advertised in Canada, promoting public health and responsible gambling.
data.shortTitle: National Framework on Advertising for Sports Betting Act
data.status: Senate bill awaiting first reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to establish a framework on animal-assisted services for veterans
data.header: The Assistance Animals Framework for Veterans Act aims to enhance the lives of veterans through animal-assisted services, focusing on mental health and rehabilitation. It promises to improve access while sparking discussions about funding and resource allocation.
data.shortTitle: Assistance Animals Framework for Veterans Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Employment Insurance Act (accessibility and other measures)
data.header: The proposed changes to Employment Insurance aim to provide better support for those in need, but they spark a debate about potential misuse and financial sustainability.
data.shortTitle: EI Overhaul: A Helping Hand or Heavy Load?

data.title: An Act to prohibit the promotion of alcoholic beverages
data.header: The Alcoholic Beverage Promotion Prohibition Act aims to curb underage drinking by regulating how alcohol can be marketed, affecting young people and businesses alike.
data.status: At second reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act to establish a national strategy on brain injuries
data.header: The National Strategy on Brain Injuries Act is designed to improve awareness and treatment for brain injuries in Canada, benefiting patients and healthcare providers alike while raising concerns about costs and resource allocation.
data.shortTitle: National Strategy on Brain Injuries Act
data.status: At report stage in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act respecting Arab Heritage Month
data.header: The Arab Heritage Month Act aims to honor Arab culture in Canada, fostering inclusivity while also raising questions about resource allocation and community representation.
data.status: At third reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act to amend the Citizenship Act and the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
data.header: This bill aims to grant citizenship to youth in foster care, helping them integrate and thrive in society, while raising concerns about social service impacts.
data.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to designate the month of October as Hungarian Heritage Month
data.header: The Hungarian Heritage Month Act aims to recognize the contributions of the Hungarian community in Canada, promoting cultural appreciation and community engagement.

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Labour Code (flight attendants)
data.header: This act aims to ensure flight attendants are paid for all their work hours, which could enhance job satisfaction but may also increase ticket prices for consumers.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and to make consequential amendments to another Act (interim release and domestic violence recognizance orders)
data.header: This new bill aims to enhance the safety of victims of intimate partner violence by implementing stricter regulations on offenders, though it raises concerns about personal freedom and judicial resource allocation.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and to make consequential amendments to other Acts (child sexual abuse and exploitation material)
data.header: This proposal aims to enhance the legal framework surrounding child sexual abuse and exploitation by redefining terminology and increasing penalties. While it seeks to better protect victims, it also raises concerns about potential burdens on the judicial system and the risk of wrongful accusations.

data.title: An Act respecting pharmacare
data.header: The Pharmacare Act aims to provide universal access to affordable prescription drugs in Canada, enhancing public health and making medications more accessible for all Canadians.

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Health Act (mental, addictions and substance use health services)
data.header: Proposed changes to the Canada Health Act aim to include mental health and addiction services, potentially improving access for those in need while also raising concerns about funding and implementation.

data.title: An Act to amend the National Capital Act (Gatineau Park)
data.header: The Gatineau Park Act aims to enhance the park's ecological management and define its boundaries while introducing potential fees, which could affect both local communities and park visitors.
data.status: At second reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act respecting the Commissioner for Modern Treaty Implementation
data.header: The Commissioner for Modern Treaty Implementation Act aims to enhance accountability in treaty agreements between the Government of Canada and Indigenous peoples, paving the way for better relationships and oversight.
data.shortTitle: Commissioner for Modern Treaty Implementation Act
data.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act respecting the implementation of a consumer-led banking system for Canadians
data.header: The Consumer-led Banking Act could reshape banking in Canada, promising more choices for consumers but also raising concerns about data security and costs for traditional banks.
data.status: At report stage in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (sterilization procedures)
data.header: This proposed amendment to the Criminal Code aims to redefine sterilization procedures, emphasizing informed consent while raising concerns about access and potential stigma for individuals seeking permanent contraception.
data.status: Senate bill awaiting first reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Post Corporation Act (seizure) and to make related amendments to other Acts
data.header: The Canadian Postal Safety Act aims to enhance the security of mail handling but introduces complexities around accountability and ownership of seized items, raising concerns for both individuals and law enforcement.
data.status: At report stage in the Senate

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada National Parks Act
data.header: The amendment to the Canada National Parks Act is changing how land use is managed in Jasper, allowing local governance to take charge. While this can boost community growth and local decision-making, it raises concerns about potential overdevelopment and environmental impacts.

data.title: An Act to amend the Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission Act (Quebec’s cultural distinctiveness and French-speaking communities)
data.header: This amendment mandates consultations with Quebec and provincial governments concerning cultural identity in broadcasting, aiming to better represent French-speaking communities but raises concerns about inefficiencies.
data.status: At report stage in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (promotion of hatred against Indigenous peoples)
data.header: This proposed amendment aims to combat hate speech against Indigenous peoples in Canada, balancing free speech with the need for respectful dialogue and protection from harmful rhetoric.

data.title: An Act to amend the Old Age Security Act (amount of full pension)
data.header: The proposed changes to the Old Age Security Act will increase pensions for seniors, allowing them to earn more without losing benefits. This move aims to help seniors manage living costs but raises concerns about public spending.
data.status: At third reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to amend the Department of Employment and Social Development Act and the Employment Insurance Act (Employment Insurance Council)
data.header: A new Employment Insurance Council aims to improve oversight and policies for EI benefits, potentially changing the way unemployed individuals receive assistance while balancing employer and worker needs.
data.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act respecting Inherited Blood Disorders Awareness Day
data.header: The Inherited Blood Disorders Awareness Day Act introduces October 18th as a special day to increase awareness about inherited blood disorders in Canada, aiming to improve public understanding and support for affected individuals and their families.
data.shortTitle: Inherited Blood Disorders Awareness Day Act
data.status: At second reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (Corinne’s Quest and the protection of children)
data.header: A proposed repeal of a controversial law aims to shift how we view parental discipline, sparking debate on child rights and family autonomy.
data.status: At third reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to develop a national framework to establish a school food program
data.header: The National Framework for a School Food Program Act aims to provide healthy meals for all children in schools across Canada, promoting better nutrition and supporting local farmers.
data.shortTitle: National Framework for a School Food Program Act
data.status: At third reading in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to enact the Protection of Minors in the Digital Age Act and to amend the Criminal Code
data.header: The Protection of Minors in the Digital Age Act aims to make online spaces safer for young users by enforcing stricter rules for digital platforms, enhancing protections against bullying and harmful content.
data.shortTitle: Promotion of Safety in the Digital Age Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Telecommunications Act (transparent and accurate broadband services information)
data.header: A new amendment to the Telecommunications Act aims to enhance transparency in internet services by requiring providers to share service quality data. While this could help consumers make informed choices, it may also lead to increased costs for telecom companies and their customers.

data.title: An Act for granting to His Majesty certain sums of money for the federal public administration for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2025
data.header: The Appropriation Act No. 3 allocates over $11 billion for federal public administration, stirring debates about fiscal responsibility and the impact on taxpayers and government services.

data.title: An Act respecting the development of a national strategy to assess, prevent and address environmental racism and to advance environmental justice
data.header: The National Strategy Respecting Environmental Racism and Environmental Justice Act aims to create a national framework to address inequities faced by marginalized communities, especially Indigenous populations, in environmental policy and protection.
data.shortTitle: National Strategy Respecting Environmental Racism and Environmental Justice Act

data.title: An Act respecting accountability, transparency and engagement to support the creation of sustainable jobs for workers and economic growth in a net-zero economy
data.header: The Canadian Sustainable Jobs Act aims to create new job opportunities while transitioning to a greener economy, promoting inclusivity for marginalized and Indigenous communities.

data.title: An Act to amend the Chemical Weapons Convention Implementation Act
data.header: This bill seeks to modernize the U.S. Chemical Weapons Convention Implementation Act, aiming for clearer definitions and improved alignment with international standards.

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Labour Code and the Canada Industrial Relations Board Regulations, 2012
data.header: Proposed amendments to the Canada Labour Code aim to strengthen workers' rights by banning replacement workers and imposing heavy fines on non-compliant businesses, raising concerns about the balance between worker protection and business flexibility.

data.title: An Act to amend the Parliament of Canada Act (Parliamentary Visual Artist Laureate)
data.header: A new role for a Parliamentary Visual Artist Laureate aims to elevate the arts in Canada, but raises questions about funding and priorities in a tight economy.

data.title: An Act for granting to His Majesty certain sums of money for the federal public administration for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2025
data.header: The Appropriation Act No. 2 for 2024–25 allocates over $117 billion to federal expenses, directly impacting public services like healthcare and education, while raising concerns about taxpayer costs and government accountability.

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Transportation Act (interswitching)
data.header: The Extended Interswitching Repeal Act proposes to eliminate certain railway regulations in Canada, potentially changing how rail services are managed, which may benefit some customers while disadvantaging others.
data.status: At second reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Revenue Agency Act (reporting on unpaid income tax)
data.header: The Fairness for All Canadian Taxpayers Act aims to make tax enforcement clearer by requiring detailed reports on tax evasion, helping honest taxpayers while possibly creating more scrutiny for those accused of evasion.
data.shortTitle: Fairness for All Canadian Taxpayers Act (measuring the tax gap to fight international tax evasion)

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (arson — wildfires and places of worship)
data.header: The new amendments to the Criminal Code aim to introduce strict penalties for starting wildfires and damaging places of worship, emphasizing the importance of protecting both our natural environment and religious sites.

data.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (campgrounds)
data.header: A proposed amendment to the Income Tax Act aims to help campground operators by excluding them from higher tax rates, potentially benefiting local economies but raising concerns for other businesses and public funding.

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Labour Code (hours of work of flight attendants)
data.header: The Fairness for Flight Attendants Act aims to ensure that flight attendants get paid for all their work, including pre-flight duties and wait times. This change could increase their pay but may also lead to higher ticket prices for airline passengers.

data.title: An Act to amend the Referendum Act
data.header: A new proposed amendment to Canada's Referendum Act could allow more public votes on important issues, enhancing democracy but also raising concerns about costs and complexity.

data.title: An Act to recognize a national livestock brand as a symbol of Canada and of the role of the West and frontier culture in building our nation
data.header: The National Livestock Brand of Canada Act aims to create a unified brand for Canadian livestock, helping farmers market their products better while potentially increasing costs and changing the landscape of competition.

data.title: An Act to establish a national framework to improve food price transparency
data.header: The National Framework for Food Price Transparency Act aims to make grocery prices clearer for consumers. While supporters believe it will help shoppers make better choices, some small retailers worry about the impact of compliance costs.

data.title: An Act respecting regulatory modernization
data.header: Proposed amendments aim to modernize regulations across multiple sectors, balancing economic growth with the need for oversight and public safety.

data.title: An Act to amend the Competition Act and the Competition Tribunal Act
data.header: The 'Lowering Prices for Canadians Act' aims to make markets fairer by enforcing stricter penalties on anti-competitive practices, which could mean lower prices for consumers but may challenge small businesses with more regulations.

data.title: An Act to correct certain anomalies, inconsistencies, out-dated terminology and errors and to deal with other matters of a non-controversial and uncomplicated nature in the Statutes and Regulations of Canada and to repeal certain provisions that have expired, lapsed or otherwise ceased to have effect
data.header: The Miscellaneous Statute Law Amendment Act, 2023 aims to modernize legal terminology, benefiting legal professionals and enhancing bilingual accessibility, though some critics question its necessity.

data.title: An Act respecting National Immigration Month
data.header: The National Immigration Month Act aims to designate November as a time to recognize and appreciate immigrants in Canada, fostering community engagement and cultural diversity while sparking debate over its financial implications.
data.status: At second reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Parliament of Canada Act
data.header: Proposed amendments to Canada's Criminal Code aim to enhance accountability in Parliament by introducing stricter penalties for perjury and contempt, which could both deter dishonest testimonies and raise concerns about fairness.

data.title: An Act to amend the Department of Canadian Heritage Act (Court Challenges Program)
data.header: The Court Challenges Program Act aims to provide crucial legal support to marginalized communities, helping them fight for their rights and ensure fairness in the legal system.
data.status: At report stage in the House of Commons

data.title: An Act to establish National Conversion Therapy Awareness Day
data.header: The National Conversion Therapy Awareness Day Act aims to establish a day for educating the public about the harms of conversion therapy, promoting acceptance and understanding of LGBTQ+ individuals.

data.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act and the Canada Pension Plan (deeming provision)
data.header: Proposed amendments to the Income Tax Act could ease access to tax credits for those with disabilities, but new stricter criteria may leave some individuals without necessary support.

data.title: An Act to amend the Marine Liability Act (national strategy respecting pollution caused by shipping container spills)
data.header: A new amendment aims to tackle pollution from shipping container spills by collaborating with Indigenous organizations and improving response strategies, potentially affecting shipping companies and local communities.

data.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (northern residents deduction)
data.header: A new bill aims to increase tax deductions for northern residents, potentially boosting their income and simplifying tax regulations, while raising concerns about government revenue and equitable benefits.

data.title: An Act to establish a framework for the continued access to and use of cash in Canada and to make related amendments to other Acts
data.header: This act ensures that cash remains accessible for all Canadians, especially those who prefer cash for privacy or lack digital access.

data.title: An Act to establish the Office of the Ombud for the Department of Citizenship and Immigration and to make related and consequential amendments to other Acts
data.header: The proposed Ombud for Immigration would oversee the fairness and transparency of Canada's immigration process, allowing citizens to address grievances while sparking debate on funding and bureaucratic efficiency.

data.title: An Act to amend the National Housing Strategy Act
data.header: This legislation aims to tackle homelessness and elevate Indigenous voices in housing decisions, promising more protections for vulnerable groups and requiring local governments to adapt their strategies.

data.title: An Act respecting transparency and accountability in relation to certain commitments Canada has made under the Convention on Biological Diversity
data.header: The Nature Accountability Act aims to strengthen Canada's commitment to biodiversity, ensuring Indigenous knowledge is included in environmental decisions while posing challenges for local governments.

data.title: An Act to amend the Excise Tax Act and the Department of Employment and Social Development Act
data.header: This amendment aims to make funeral services more affordable by removing excise taxes on essential items, helping families through a challenging time.

data.title: An Act to amend the Excise Tax Act (carbon pollution pricing)
data.header: A proposed amendment aims to eliminate GST on carbon pollution pricing, potentially lowering costs for consumers and businesses while raising concerns about government funding for climate initiatives.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (public transit workers)
data.header: This amendment to the Criminal Code seeks to improve safety for public transit workers by considering their profession in assault cases, potentially leading to tougher penalties for offenders.

data.title: An Act to amend the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (importing, exporting and producing certain substances)

data.header: The Pandemic Prevention and Preparedness Act aims to strengthen Canada's health system against future pandemics by improving public health strategies and collaboration, benefiting vulnerable populations and public health workers.

data.title: An Act to establish a national strategy respecting flood and drought forecasting

data.title: An Act respecting the interoperability of health information technology and to prohibit data blocking by health information technology vendors

data.title: An Act to provide for the imposition of restrictive measures against foreign hostage takers and those who practice arbitrary detention in state-to-state relations and to make related amendments to the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) and Terrorist Financing Act and the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act

data.title: An Act respecting a national strategy for children and youth in Canada

data.title: An Act respecting a national framework on sickle cell disease

data.title: An Act respecting Jury Duty Appreciation Week

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Indian Act
data.header: The proposed amendments aim to give First Nations greater control over lottery schemes, helping them generate revenue for local projects while raising concerns about the potential impact on vulnerable populations.

data.title: An Act respecting National Diffuse Midline Glioma Awareness Day

data.title: An Act to establish the Foreign Influence Registry and to amend the Criminal Code
data.header: The Foreign Influence Registry and Accountability Act mandates that individuals representing foreign entities must report their interactions with Canadian officials. This initiative is designed to enhance transparency in politics, but raises concerns about compliance burdens and potential impacts on foreign investment.
data.shortTitle: Foreign Influence Registry and Accountability Act
data.status: At second reading in the Senate

data.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act and the Canada Student Financial Assistance Act
data.header: The Post-Secondary Education Financial Assistance for Persons with Disabilities Act aims to help individuals with disabilities afford college by offering financial support, allowing them to pursue their educational goals.
data.shortTitle: Post-Secondary Education Financial Assistance for Persons with Disabilities Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Parliament of Canada Act (change of political affiliation)
data.header: A new amendment proposes that MPs must resign and hold a by-election if they switch parties, stirring debate on political accountability versus freedom.

data.title: An Act to change the name of the electoral district of Châteauguay—Lacolle
data.header: This bill proposes renaming an electoral district to enhance local identity and representation, sparking discussions on community connection and budget priorities.

data.title: An Act to amend the Bank of Canada Act and to make consequential amendments to other Acts
data.header: The Bank of Canada Accountability Act aims to enhance financial transparency by introducing mandatory audits, but it raises concerns about costs and bureaucratic inefficiencies that could impact public services.

data.title: An Act respecting the development of a federal framework on the conservation of fish stocks and management of pinnipeds
data.header: The Conservation of Fish Stocks and Management of Pinnipeds Act aims to safeguard fish populations and manage seal numbers. It looks to foster collaboration among various stakeholders for a healthier marine environment, benefiting both the economy and ecology in coastal regions.
data.shortTitle: Conservation of Fish Stocks and Management of Pinnipeds Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (prohibition — promotion of antisemitism)
data.header: A proposed amendment aims to criminalize statements promoting antisemitism, potentially impacting free speech and the legal landscape surrounding hate speech.
data.shortTitle: Hate Speech Law for Holocaust Denial

data.title: An Act respecting the encouragement of the growth of the cryptoasset sector
data.header: The Encouraging the Growth of the Cryptoasset Sector Act aims to set up a national framework to regulate the growing crypto industry, balancing innovation with necessary investor protections.
data.shortTitle: Encouraging the Growth of the Cryptoasset Sector Act

data.title: An Act to prohibit fur farming
data.header: The Prohibition of Fur Farming Act aims to completely outlaw fur farming, targeting the ownership and breeding of fur-bearing animals while imposing hefty penalties for violations. Its introduction could significantly affect workers in the industry and raise important debates about animal welfare and economic impacts.

data.title: An Act to amend the Constitution Act, 1867 (representation in the House of Commons)
data.header: The proposed amendment to the Constitution Act could significantly increase Quebec's representation in federal politics, leading to debates over costs, regional balance, and political influence across Canada.

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Infrastructure Bank Act
data.header: A new emphasis on climate-focused infrastructure projects aims to empower Indigenous communities and promote transparency, but raises concerns on spending and oversight.

data.title: An Act respecting the elimination of the use of forced labour and child labour in supply chains
data.header: The Ending the Use of Forced Labour and Child Labour in Supply Chains Act requires businesses in Canada to report on their efforts to fight forced and child labor in their supply chains, fostering greater corporate accountability and ethical practices.
data.shortTitle: Ending the Use of Forced Labour and Child Labour in Supply Chains Act

data.title: An Act to continue VIA Rail Canada Inc. under the name VIA Rail Canada and to make consequential amendments to other Acts
data.header: The VIA Rail Canada Act is set to enhance the governance and operation of Canada's federal rail service, aiming for better regional connectivity and financial oversight, while sparking debates over its potential impact on taxpayers and public services.

data.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (donations involving private corporation shares or real estate)
data.header: A new amendment could help increase charitable donations by exempting capital gains taxes on real estate and shares given to qualified charities, potentially benefiting nonprofits and community programs.

data.title: An Act to amend An Act to authorize the making of certain fiscal payments to provinces, and to authorize the entry into tax collection agreements with provinces
data.header: This proposed amendment allows provinces to collect federal taxes, potentially simplifying processes but also raising concerns about confusion and job impacts.

data.title: An Act respecting the French language
data.header: This bill aims to prioritize French in Quebec's workplaces, affecting businesses and the citizenship process for newcomers, sparking debate over its economic and social impact.

data.title: An Act to amend the Federal-Provincial Fiscal Arrangements Act and the Canada Health Act
data.header: Quebec may gain more control over its healthcare, allowing for tailored services while raising concerns about the impact on healthcare equity across Canada.

data.title: An Act to amend the Competition Act (vehicle repair)
data.header: New regulations aim to enhance competition in the vehicle repair market, benefiting consumers and independent shops while posing challenges for manufacturers and small businesses.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (intimidation of health care professionals)
data.header: This bill aims to protect health care professionals from being forced to participate in medical assistance in dying (MAID) against their beliefs, while also raising concerns about patient access to these services.
data.shortTitle: Protection of Freedom of Conscience Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (use of resources of a registered charity)
data.header: The Effective and Accountable Charities Act could revolutionize how charities operate by granting them more freedom to allocate resources. While this aims to enhance innovation in addressing social needs, it stirs debate over accountability and the risk of fund misuse.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (banning symbols of hate)
data.header: The Banning Symbols of Hate Act aims to make it illegal to display or sell symbols tied to hate groups, promoting safety for marginalized communities while raising concerns about free speech.

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Elections Act (voting age)
data.header: A proposed amendment to the Canada Elections Act aims to lower the federal voting age to 16, giving younger Canadians a voice in politics and shaping the future.

data.title: An Act to amend the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act, the Companies’ Creditors Arrangement Act and the Pension Benefits Standards Act, 1985 (pension plans and group insurance plans)
data.header: This legislation aims to prioritize pension fund claims during company bankruptcies, offering greater security for employees' retirement savings but potentially creating challenges for struggling businesses.

data.title: An Act to provide further support in response to COVID-19
data.header: This proposal aims to extend crucial financial support for those impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, ensuring employees and businesses can continue to thrive as the economy recovers.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Canada Labour Code
data.header: Proposed changes to the Criminal and Labour Codes aim to enhance protections in healthcare and provide extended leave for grieving workers, balancing employee needs with business challenges.

data.title: An Act for granting to Her Majesty certain sums of money for the federal public administration for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2022
data.header: The Appropriation Act No. 4 allocates $8.75 billion for unplanned federal expenses, impacting government employees and taxpayers. It aims to ensure continuous public services but may lead to higher taxes and national debt.

data.title: An Act to develop a national framework for a guaranteed livable basic income
data.header: The National Framework for a Guaranteed Livable Basic Income Act aims to provide financial support to Canadians aged 17 and older, helping those in poverty and facing employment challenges while sparking debate over potential costs and fairness.
data.shortTitle: National Framework for a Guaranteed Livable Basic Income Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (travel expenses deduction for tradespersons)
data.header: A new amendment to the Income Tax Act could help tradespeople deduct travel expenses for jobs far from home, providing financial relief while also raising concerns about government tax revenue.

data.title: An Act to amend certain Acts in relation to survivor pension benefits
data.header: Proposed changes to military and public service pension benefits aim to better support survivors and children of deceased personnel, but raise concerns over financial sustainability and equity among beneficiaries.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (assault against a health care worker)
data.header: This proposed amendment aims to protect healthcare workers from assaults by imposing harsher penalties on offenders, potentially making medical environments safer.

data.title: An Act to enact the Canadian Environmental Bill of Rights and to make related amendments to other Acts
data.header: The Canadian Environmental Bill of Rights strengthens the community's ability to protect their environment by holding corporations and the government accountable for their actions, fostering greater public participation in environmental governance.

data.title: An Act to amend the Excise Tax Act (psychotherapy services)
data.header: A new amendment proposes to exempt psychotherapy services from GST, aiming to make mental health support more affordable and accessible for everyone.

data.title: An Act respecting the development of a national strategy in relation to fresh water
data.header: The National Freshwater Strategy Act aims to safeguard our vital freshwater resources through an inclusive national approach, addressing climate challenges and ensuring clean drinking water for all communities.

data.title: An Act to amend the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act and to enact the Expungement of Certain Drug-related Convictions Act and the National Strategy on Substance Use Act
data.header: This legislation aims to shift the focus from criminalization to health support for individuals with substance use issues, potentially reshaping law enforcement priorities and increasing access to treatment.
data.shortTitle: Health-based Approach to Substance Use Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Canadian Navigable Waters Act (lakes and rivers in British Columbia)
data.header: The proposed amendments to the Canadian Navigable Waters Act aim to expand designated waterways in British Columbia, promoting better access and environmental protection while sparking debates over economic impacts and property rights.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (criminal interest rate)
data.header: This bill aims to protect vulnerable borrowers from predatory lending by redefining interest rates and including additional fees in calculations. While it seeks to create a fairer lending market, it could also limit access to credit for those who need it most.

data.title: An Act to develop a national school food program for children
data.header: The School Food Program for Children Act proposes a national initiative to ensure every child in Canada has access to nutritious food in schools, targeting those who struggle most to obtain it.
data.shortTitle: School Food Program for Children Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Labour Code (bereavement leave)
data.header: Proposed changes to the Canada Labour Code will provide grieving parents with extended leave options after experiencing the loss of a child, stillbirth, or miscarriage, aiming to create a more supportive workplace environment.

data.title: An Act to amend the Canada Elections Act (voting age)
data.header: The 'Right to Vote at 16 Act' proposes lowering Canada's federal voting age to 16, empowering younger citizens to influence important issues that shape their future. While this could increase civic engagement, it also raises questions about readiness and budget impacts for voter education.

data.title: An Act to amend the Parliament of Canada Act and to make consequential and related amendments to other Acts
data.header: Proposed changes to the Parliament of Canada Act focus on increasing financial allowances for senators and adjusting their appointment processes. This could impact taxpayers and political parties, creating debates about fairness and government spending.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act and to make consequential amendments to another Act
data.header: Proposed changes to minimum penalties in crimes aim to give judges more discretion, impacting drug offenses and serious crimes, with potential effects on public safety and rehabilitation efforts.

data.title: An Act respecting early learning and child care
data.header: The Early Learning and Child Care Act aims to boost early education across Canada by providing funding while ensuring provinces meet high standards. This initiative could greatly benefit families, especially in Indigenous communities, but raises concerns about potential financial strains and accessibility disparities.
data.shortTitle: Early Learning and Child Care Act

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (conversion therapy)

data.title: An Act to amend the Parliament of Canada Act and to make consequential and related amendments to other Acts
data.header: Proposed amendments to the Parliament of Canada Act suggest increasing senator allowances, aiming for better representation and inclusivity. However, this move raises concerns about government spending and public trust during tough economic times.

data.title: An Act to amend the Canadian Bill of Rights (right to housing)

data.title: An Act to amend the National Defence Act (maiming or injuring self or another)

data.header: An amendment to the Impact Assessment Act is changing coal mining regulations, allowing new entrants without production limits, which could impact local economies and environmental safety.

data.title: An Act to amend the Language Skills Act (Lieutenant Governor of New Brunswick)

data.title: An Act respecting Ukrainian Heritage Month
data.header: The Ukrainian Heritage Month Act aims to celebrate and promote the rich culture of Ukrainian Canadians each September, fostering community engagement and cultural pride while raising questions about inclusivity and resource allocation.

data.header: The Soil Conservation Act aims to boost soil health in Canada by engaging farmers, stakeholders, and communities while raising awareness through special observance days. It faces financial challenges but is seen as vital for sustainable agriculture.

data.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (controlling or coercive conduct)

data.header: Proposed changes to how the Senate elects its Speaker and Deputy Speaker aim to enhance accountability and democratize leadership roles through secret ballot elections among senators.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board Act (investments)
