bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (medical assistance in dying)
bill_list.header: This amendment aims to clarify that individuals with mental health conditions are not eligible for medical assistance in dying, focusing on safeguarding vulnerable populations while sparking debate on personal autonomy and mental health care.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (justification for detention in custody)
bill_list.header: Proposed changes to the Criminal Code aim to increase the burden of proof for detained individuals before trial. This could impact various groups and lead to financial implications for the justice system.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the development of a national renewable energy strategy
bill_list.header: The National Renewable Energy Strategy Act aims to transition Canada to 100% renewable electricity by 2030, impacting homeowners, workers, and government budgets as it prioritizes sustainability and technological investments.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (violence against pregnant women)
bill_list.header: The Violence Against Pregnant Women Act seeks to enhance legal protections for pregnant individuals by imposing stricter penalties on crimes committed against them, addressing their unique vulnerabilities.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the building of a green economy in the Prairies
bill_list.header: The Building a Green Prairie Economy Act aims to foster a sustainable economy in Canada's Prairie provinces through collaboration on clean technology, but it raises financial and bureaucratic concerns for local workers and governments.
bill_list.shortTitle: Building a Green Prairie Economy Act

bill_list.title: An Act for granting to His Majesty certain sums of money for the federal public administration for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2023
bill_list.header: The Appropriation Act aims to allocate nearly $20.8 billion to support federal services, but it raises crucial questions about transparency and accountability in government spending.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Identification of Criminals Act and to make related amendments to other Acts (COVID-19 response and other measures)
bill_list.header: This proposal aims to update the Criminal Code by integrating technology into law enforcement and court proceedings, making justice more efficient and accessible, while raising important concerns about civil liberties.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting a National Ribbon Skirt Day
bill_list.header: The National Ribbon Skirt Day Act aims to honor Indigenous cultures by designating January 4th as a day to celebrate the ribbon skirt, fostering awareness and appreciation of Indigenous identity.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (trafficking in human organs)
bill_list.header: This proposed amendment fights human organ trafficking by implementing strict penalties and expanding legal frameworks to protect vulnerable individuals, both at home and abroad.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Indian Act (new registration entitlements)
bill_list.header: Proposed amendments to the Indian Act aim to improve the classification and registration of Indigenous peoples, addressing historical discrimination while potentially increasing access and recognition for many.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Department of Employment and Social Development Act and to make consequential amendments to other Acts (Employment Insurance Board of Appeal)
bill_list.header: Proposed changes to the Employment Insurance Act aim to create a new Board of Appeal for a smoother and fairer decision process for claimants, but there are concerns about potential costs and appeal volume.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Employment Insurance Act (illness, injury or quarantine)
bill_list.header: This proposed amendment aims to significantly extend Employment Insurance benefits for those facing long-term health challenges, providing much-needed financial support during their recovery.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (volunteer firefighting and search and rescue volunteer tax credit)
bill_list.header: This proposed amendment aims to increase tax credits for volunteer firefighters and search and rescue volunteers, offering them financial relief while raising concerns about its impact on other essential public services.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act and the Companies' Creditors Arrangement Act (public institutions)
bill_list.header: This bill proposes changes to bankruptcy laws that would exempt certain public institutions from insolvency, aiming to protect critical services but raising concerns about financial accountability.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canadian Human Rights Act (protecting against discrimination based on political belief)
bill_list.header: This proposed amendment aims to protect individuals from discrimination based on their political beliefs, promoting a more inclusive environment while raising concerns about implementation costs and potential community tensions.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the National Strategy to Combat Human Trafficking
bill_list.header: The National Strategy to Combat Human Trafficking Act aims to enhance prevention and support for victims of trafficking in Canada, focusing on better law enforcement and adherence to human rights standards.
bill_list.shortTitle: National Strategy to Combat Human Trafficking Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Labour Code (menstrual products)
bill_list.header: A new amendment proposes that federally regulated employers must provide free menstrual products to promote hygiene and inclusivity, especially benefiting those who struggle financially.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act
bill_list.header: This bill aims to shift the focus from punishment to rehabilitation for drug offenses, creating opportunities for treatment instead of incarceration.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting cost of living relief measures related to dental care and rental housing
bill_list.header: The Cost of Living Relief Act, No. 2 aims to assist Canadian families facing financial strains with benefits for dental care and rental support, but it raises questions about its long-term effectiveness and privacy concerns.
bill_list.shortTitle: Cost of Living Relief Act, No. 2 (Targeted Support for Households)

bill_list.title: An Act to establish National Women’s Entrepreneurship Day
bill_list.header: The National Women's Entrepreneurship Day Act highlights women's contributions to business, aiming to inspire and support women entrepreneurs while raising critical discussions on effective resource allocation.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Canadian Victims Bill of Rights (information about the victim)
bill_list.header: The Véronique Barbe Act aims to safeguard victims of crime by preventing defendants from sharing sensitive information online, enhancing their privacy and safety in legal proceedings.
bill_list.status: At consideration in committee in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Shipping Act, 2001 (anchorage prohibition)
bill_list.header: New restrictions on where large vessels can anchor aim to protect marine environments, but they could challenge the shipping industry and increase costs for consumers.

bill_list.title: An Act to establish National Food Waste Awareness Day
bill_list.header: The National Food Waste Awareness Day Act aims to dedicate October 20th as a day to educate Canadians about the impacts of food waste, promoting sustainable practices and community involvement.
bill_list.shortTitle: National Food Waste Awareness Day Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (murder of an intimate partner, one's own child or an intimate partner's child)
bill_list.header: This proposed amendment aims to classify certain murders as first-degree offenses, enhancing legal protections for domestic violence victims but raising concerns about cost and judicial discretion.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Royal Canadian Mounted Police Act
bill_list.header: This amendment seeks to clarify the authority of the Minister over the RCMP, aiming to boost accountability while balancing influence on law enforcement. It could reshape how police priorities are set and impact public trust.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Labour Code (replacement workers)
bill_list.header: This bill aims to protect workers during strikes by preventing employers from hiring replacement workers, promoting fair negotiations and stronger collective bargaining rights.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Student Financial Assistance Act, the Canada Student Loans Act and the Apprentice Loans Act (interest on student loans)
bill_list.header: This proposal aims to eliminate interest on student loans, making education more accessible while raising concerns about taxpayer costs and potential financial impacts.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Prohibiting Cluster Munitions Act (investments)
bill_list.header: The Cluster Munitions Investment Prohibition Act aims to stop Canadian investments in companies that use cluster munitions, promoting adherence to international humanitarian laws and potentially reshaping the defense industry.
bill_list.status: At consideration in committee in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Department of Public Works and Government Services Act, the Defence Production Act and the Federal-Provincial Fiscal Arrangements Act (Canadian products and services)
bill_list.header: This bill aims to prioritize Canadian products in government contracts, benefiting local businesses and potentially raising costs for consumers.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Customs Act and the Preclearance Act, 2016
bill_list.header: New amendments to the Customs Act could allow border officers to conduct invasive searches of digital devices, raising privacy concerns and impacting travelers and international trade.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the Declaration on the Essential Role of Artists and Creative Expression in Canada
bill_list.header: This Act highlights the importance of artists and cultural expression in Canada, aiming to provide more resources and support while facing concerns about funding and bureaucratic delays.
bill_list.shortTitle: Declaration on the Essential Role of Artists and Creative Expression in Canada Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (disclosure of information by jurors)
bill_list.header: A new bill allows jurors to seek mental health help without the fear of legal repercussions, aiming to improve their well-being and the overall jury process.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (temporary enhancement to the Goods and Services Tax/Harmonized Sales Tax credit)
bill_list.header: This proposed act aims to support low- and middle-income families facing rising living costs by doubling the GST/HST credit for six months, though it introduces a complicated payment formula.
bill_list.shortTitle: Cost of Living Relief Act, No. 1 (Targeted Tax Relief)

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (life imprisonment)
bill_list.header: Proposed amendments to the Criminal Code aim to toughen penalties for serious crimes, introducing life sentences for offenses like human trafficking and exploitation of minors, which sparks debate on justice versus rehabilitation.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (economic substance)
bill_list.header: A new amendment to the Income Tax Act aims to redefine economic substance in tax matters, impacting how businesses operate and potentially changing the way taxes are assessed and collected.

bill_list.title: An Act to give effect to the Anishinabek Nation Governance Agreement, to amend the Sechelt Indian Band Self-Government Act and the Yukon First Nations Self-Government Act and to make related and consequential amendments to other Acts
bill_list.header: The Anishinabek Nation Governance Agreement Act aims to boost Indigenous self-governance, granting more control over governance, culture, and funding, while balancing benefits with financial risks and responsibilities.

bill_list.title: An Act for granting to Her Majesty certain sums of money for the federal public administration for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2023
bill_list.header: The Appropriation Act No. 2, 2022–23 allocates over $115 billion for government services but raises concerns about fiscal responsibility and transparency.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Constitution Act, 1867 (electoral representation)
bill_list.header: This act aims to protect the representation of less populous provinces in Canada's House of Commons, ensuring they maintain their number of MPs despite demographic changes. It highlights the balance between fair governance and the financial implications of maintaining representation.
bill_list.shortTitle: Preserving Provincial Representation in the House of Commons Act

bill_list.title: An Act for granting to Her Majesty certain sums of money for the federal public administration for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2023
bill_list.header: The Appropriation Act No. 3 aims to allocate $8.8 billion for unforeseen federal expenses, stirring debate on fiscal responsibility and potential impacts on taxpayers and public services.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (self-induced extreme intoxication)
bill_list.header: A new bill aims to hold individuals responsible for violent crimes even if intoxicated, raising concerns about fairness and the impact on those with substance use issues.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Elections Act (Indigenous languages)
bill_list.header: This amendment to the Canada Elections Act aims to make ballots available in both official and Indigenous languages, enhancing accessibility for Indigenous voters and promoting inclusivity in the electoral process.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (increasing parole ineligibility)
bill_list.header: This act aims to impose mandatory life sentences for serious crimes, promising a stronger justice message for victims' families while raising concerns about the financial and social impacts of such lengthy penalties.
bill_list.shortTitle: Respecting Families of Murdered and Brutalized Persons Act

bill_list.title: An Act respecting transparency for online algorithms
bill_list.header: The Online Algorithm Transparency Act aims to make online platforms more transparent about their data practices, ensuring fairness and reducing algorithmic bias that affects marginalized communities.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (identity verification)
bill_list.header: A proposed amendment could impose severe penalties for false identity verification in financial transactions, impacting both individuals and businesses significantly.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Pest Control Products Act (glyphosate)
bill_list.header: This amendment proposes a complete ban on glyphosate, a common herbicide, within a year to protect public health and the environment. The impact on farmers and consumers could be significant, as it may lead to challenges in weed management and higher food prices.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (recognition of foreign credentials)
bill_list.header: The Recognition of Foreign Credentials Act aims to help skilled immigrants gain better access to jobs in Canada by recognizing their foreign educational credentials, addressing labor shortages and potentially boosting the economy.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canadian Human Rights Act, the Canada Labour Code and the Employment Insurance Act
bill_list.header: The Medical Freedom Act aims to protect individuals from discrimination based on their health choices, impacting employees, employers, and consumers in Canada.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Corrections and Conditional Release Act (addiction treatment in penitentiaries)
bill_list.header: This bill aims to help offenders with substance use issues by allowing them to serve their sentences in treatment facilities instead of prisons, promoting rehabilitation and addressing addiction.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting places, persons and events of national historic significance or national interest, archaeological resources and cultural and natural heritage
bill_list.header: The Historic Places of Canada Act aims to safeguard and celebrate Canada's diverse cultural heritage, especially by incorporating Indigenous perspectives while also facing budgetary challenges.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (criminal organizations)
bill_list.header: A proposed amendment aims to reshape definitions of criminal organizations, impacting nonprofits and businesses while enhancing law enforcement's combat against organized crime.

bill_list.title: An Act to prevent the imposition by the federal government of vaccination mandates for employment and travel
bill_list.header: The Prevention of Government-imposed Vaccination Mandates Act eliminates the requirement for COVID-19 vaccinations for federal employees and transport users, sparking a heated discussion on personal freedom versus public health safety.
bill_list.shortTitle: Prevention of Government-imposed Vaccination Mandates Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Justice for Victims of Corrupt Foreign Officials Act (Sergei Magnitsky Law)
bill_list.header: New amendments to the Justice for Victims of Corrupt Foreign Officials Act empower the government to take stronger actions against foreign nationals involved in serious human rights violations, including asset seizures and compliance monitoring.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Labour Code (replacement workers)
bill_list.header: Proposed changes to the Canada Labour Code aim to enhance job security for striking workers, but may pose challenges for small businesses adapting to new restrictions on replacement hires.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (detention in custody)
bill_list.header: A new amendment proposes stricter rules for releasing individuals charged with serious crimes, aiming to keep repeat offenders in custody. This could affect communities and raise costs for taxpayers, sparking a debate about justice and public safety.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting measures in relation to the financial stability of post-secondary institutions
bill_list.header: This act aims to shield post-secondary institutions in Canada from bankruptcy, helping them continue operations and potentially securing jobs and educational paths for students, but raises concerns about taxpayer funding and accountability.
bill_list.status: At consideration in committee in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the development of a national employment strategy for persons with disabilities
bill_list.header: The Employing Persons with Disabilities Act aims to create more job opportunities for individuals with disabilities by promoting inclusivity and raising awareness among employers about their capabilities.

bill_list.title: An Act to give legal capacity to the St. Lawrence River and to provide for measures respecting its protection
bill_list.header: The St. Lawrence River Capacity and Protection Act aims to give the St. Lawrence River its own legal rights, focusing on environmental protection and Indigenous rights while balancing local economic needs.
bill_list.shortTitle: St. Lawrence River Capacity and Protection Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (independence of the judiciary)
bill_list.header: This bill aims to give judges more flexibility in sentencing, allowing for more tailored approaches based on individual cases, but raises concerns about potential inconsistencies and public safety.
bill_list.status: At consideration in committee in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Telecommunications Act (suicide prevention)
bill_list.header: A new amendment aims to create a dedicated phone number for suicide-prevention services, making it easier for those in crisis to access mental health support.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the repurposing of certain seized, frozen or sequestrated assets
bill_list.header: The Frozen Assets Repurposing Act aims to create a transparent way to handle assets frozen due to human rights violations, helping victims and promoting justice while raising questions about costs and administrative challenges.

bill_list.title: An Act to designate the month of November as Lebanese Heritage Month
bill_list.header: The Lebanese Heritage Month Act aims to recognize and celebrate the contributions of Lebanese Canadians, promoting inclusivity and cultural awareness across the nation.

bill_list.title: An Act for granting to Her Majesty certain sums of money for the federal public administration for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2023
bill_list.header: The Appropriation Act No. 1 outlines a significant $75.48 billion government spending plan aimed at supporting crucial public services, with potential impacts on healthcare, education, and infrastructure sectors.

bill_list.title: An Act for granting to Her Majesty certain sums of money for the federal public administration for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2022
bill_list.header: The Appropriation Act No. 5 authorizes significant federal spending aimed at supporting essential public services, but raises concerns about potential future fiscal burdens and mismanagement of taxpayer dollars.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Excise Act (non-alcoholic beer)
bill_list.header: This amendment could make lower-alcohol beer cheaper, benefiting consumers and local breweries, but it may also impact public services supported by excise taxes.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Excise Act and the Excise Act, 2001 (adjusted duties - beer, malt liquor, spirits and wine)
bill_list.header: The proposed changes to the Excise Act could reshape the way alcohol is taxed, impacting local breweries and consumers alike, while stirring debate on economic fairness and revenue stability.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the development of a national perinatal mental health strategy
bill_list.header: The National Perinatal Mental Health Strategy Act seeks to improve mental health services for expecting and new parents in Canada, ensuring they have better access to screening and treatment for perinatal mental health disorders.
bill_list.shortTitle: National Perinatal Mental Health Strategy Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act and the Companies’ Creditors Arrangement Act (pension plans and group insurance plans)
bill_list.header: This proposed bill aims to protect employee pensions during bankruptcy by prioritizing pension payments, ensuring workers get their owed benefits first. It also gives companies a grace period to adjust to these important changes.

bill_list.title: An Act to establish the Office of the Commissioner for Responsible Business Conduct Abroad and to make consequential amendments to other Acts
bill_list.header: The Responsible Business Conduct Abroad Act aims to monitor Canadian companies to ensure they uphold international human rights laws, stirring a debate over corporate responsibility and economic impact.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the corporate responsibility to prevent, address and remedy adverse impacts on human rights occurring in relation to business activities conducted abroad
bill_list.header: The Corporate Responsibility to Protect Human Rights Act aims to ensure that businesses actively prevent human rights violations linked to their operations worldwide. It establishes a framework for accountability while balancing the impact on corporations, especially smaller ones.
bill_list.shortTitle: Corporate Responsibility to Protect Human Rights Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Canadian Human Rights Act and to make related amendments to another Act (hate propaganda, hate crimes and hate speech)
bill_list.header: This proposed bill aims to enhance protections against hate crimes and speech by tightening regulations and expanding law enforcement powers, aiming to create a safer environment for marginalized communities.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Federal-Provincial Fiscal Arrangements Act and to authorize certain payments to be made out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund
bill_list.header: This federal funding will help improve housing and transit services in major Canadian provinces, particularly benefiting urban residents while raising concerns about fair distribution and long-term sustainability.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

bill_list.title: An Act relating to cash contributions by Canada and to criteria and conditions in respect of post-secondary education
bill_list.header: The Canada Post-Secondary Education Act is designed to improve federal funding for colleges and universities by setting new criteria for provinces. It could reshape tuition costs and impact the quality of education across Canada.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Aeronautics Act (collision avoidance system)
bill_list.header: A new amendment to the Aeronautics Act is set to enhance flight safety by mandating GPS collision avoidance systems in gliders, though this may bring significant costs and challenges for smaller operators.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Old Age Security Act (definition of income)
bill_list.header: A new amendment could redefine income for seniors, allowing them to keep more benefits and face less tax worry. However, it raises concerns over potentially higher government spending and fiscal sustainability.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting certain measures related to COVID-19
bill_list.header: This bill aims to allocate $2.5 billion for COVID-19 testing to enhance public health responses and effectively manage the ongoing pandemic in Canada.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Fisheries Act (closed containment aquaculture)
bill_list.header: A new amendment to Canada’s Fisheries Act aims to protect the environment by requiring fish farming to occur in closed containment systems, impacting both the economy and job market.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Old Age Security Act (Guaranteed Income Supplement)
bill_list.header: This bill aims to provide more financial aid for seniors by altering how their income is calculated, potentially increasing their benefits while raising concerns about government spending.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canadian Human Rights Act (protecting against discrimination based on political belief)
bill_list.header: The proposed amendments to the Canadian Human Rights Act aim to protect individuals from discrimination based on their political beliefs, fostering inclusivity and freedom of expression.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Financial Administration Act (composition of boards of directors)
bill_list.header: This amendment mandates equal gender representation on the boards of Crown corporations, aiming to enhance women's roles in leadership and promote social equity, though it raises concerns about merit and hiring practices.
bill_list.shortTitle: An Act to amend the Financial Administration Act (composition of boards of directors)

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (criminal interest rate)
bill_list.header: This bill aims to change how we define criminal interest rates, possibly leading to more flexible loans for some but raising concerns about predatory lending practices for vulnerable borrowers.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to establish the Foreign Influence Registry and to amend the Criminal Code
bill_list.header: The Foreign Influence Registry and Accountability Act mandates that individuals representing foreign entities must report their interactions with Canadian officials. This initiative is designed to enhance transparency in politics, but raises concerns about compliance burdens and potential impacts on foreign investment.
bill_list.shortTitle: Foreign Influence Registry and Accountability Act
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act and the Canada Student Financial Assistance Act
bill_list.header: The Post-Secondary Education Financial Assistance for Persons with Disabilities Act aims to help individuals with disabilities afford college by offering financial support, allowing them to pursue their educational goals.
bill_list.shortTitle: Post-Secondary Education Financial Assistance for Persons with Disabilities Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Parliament of Canada Act (change of political affiliation)
bill_list.header: A new amendment proposes that MPs must resign and hold a by-election if they switch parties, stirring debate on political accountability versus freedom.

bill_list.title: An Act to change the name of the electoral district of Châteauguay—Lacolle
bill_list.header: This bill proposes renaming an electoral district to enhance local identity and representation, sparking discussions on community connection and budget priorities.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Bank of Canada Act and to make consequential amendments to other Acts
bill_list.header: The Bank of Canada Accountability Act aims to enhance financial transparency by introducing mandatory audits, but it raises concerns about costs and bureaucratic inefficiencies that could impact public services.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the development of a federal framework on the conservation of fish stocks and management of pinnipeds
bill_list.header: The Conservation of Fish Stocks and Management of Pinnipeds Act aims to safeguard fish populations and manage seal numbers. It looks to foster collaboration among various stakeholders for a healthier marine environment, benefiting both the economy and ecology in coastal regions.
bill_list.shortTitle: Conservation of Fish Stocks and Management of Pinnipeds Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (prohibition — promotion of antisemitism)
bill_list.header: A proposed amendment aims to criminalize statements promoting antisemitism, potentially impacting free speech and the legal landscape surrounding hate speech.
bill_list.shortTitle: Hate Speech Law for Holocaust Denial

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the encouragement of the growth of the cryptoasset sector
bill_list.header: The Encouraging the Growth of the Cryptoasset Sector Act aims to set up a national framework to regulate the growing crypto industry, balancing innovation with necessary investor protections.
bill_list.shortTitle: Encouraging the Growth of the Cryptoasset Sector Act

bill_list.title: An Act to prohibit fur farming
bill_list.header: The Prohibition of Fur Farming Act aims to completely outlaw fur farming, targeting the ownership and breeding of fur-bearing animals while imposing hefty penalties for violations. Its introduction could significantly affect workers in the industry and raise important debates about animal welfare and economic impacts.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Constitution Act, 1867 (representation in the House of Commons)
bill_list.header: The proposed amendment to the Constitution Act could significantly increase Quebec's representation in federal politics, leading to debates over costs, regional balance, and political influence across Canada.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Infrastructure Bank Act
bill_list.header: A new emphasis on climate-focused infrastructure projects aims to empower Indigenous communities and promote transparency, but raises concerns on spending and oversight.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the elimination of the use of forced labour and child labour in supply chains
bill_list.header: The Ending the Use of Forced Labour and Child Labour in Supply Chains Act requires businesses in Canada to report on their efforts to fight forced and child labor in their supply chains, fostering greater corporate accountability and ethical practices.
bill_list.shortTitle: Ending the Use of Forced Labour and Child Labour in Supply Chains Act

bill_list.title: An Act to continue VIA Rail Canada Inc. under the name VIA Rail Canada and to make consequential amendments to other Acts
bill_list.header: The VIA Rail Canada Act is set to enhance the governance and operation of Canada's federal rail service, aiming for better regional connectivity and financial oversight, while sparking debates over its potential impact on taxpayers and public services.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (donations involving private corporation shares or real estate)
bill_list.header: A new amendment could help increase charitable donations by exempting capital gains taxes on real estate and shares given to qualified charities, potentially benefiting nonprofits and community programs.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend An Act to authorize the making of certain fiscal payments to provinces, and to authorize the entry into tax collection agreements with provinces
bill_list.header: This proposed amendment allows provinces to collect federal taxes, potentially simplifying processes but also raising concerns about confusion and job impacts.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the French language
bill_list.header: This bill aims to prioritize French in Quebec's workplaces, affecting businesses and the citizenship process for newcomers, sparking debate over its economic and social impact.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Federal-Provincial Fiscal Arrangements Act and the Canada Health Act
bill_list.header: Quebec may gain more control over its healthcare, allowing for tailored services while raising concerns about the impact on healthcare equity across Canada.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Competition Act (vehicle repair)
bill_list.header: New regulations aim to enhance competition in the vehicle repair market, benefiting consumers and independent shops while posing challenges for manufacturers and small businesses.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (intimidation of health care professionals)
bill_list.header: This bill aims to protect health care professionals from being forced to participate in medical assistance in dying (MAID) against their beliefs, while also raising concerns about patient access to these services.
bill_list.shortTitle: Protection of Freedom of Conscience Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (use of resources of a registered charity)
bill_list.header: The Effective and Accountable Charities Act could revolutionize how charities operate by granting them more freedom to allocate resources. While this aims to enhance innovation in addressing social needs, it stirs debate over accountability and the risk of fund misuse.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (banning symbols of hate)
bill_list.header: The Banning Symbols of Hate Act aims to make it illegal to display or sell symbols tied to hate groups, promoting safety for marginalized communities while raising concerns about free speech.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Elections Act (voting age)
bill_list.header: A proposed amendment to the Canada Elections Act aims to lower the federal voting age to 16, giving younger Canadians a voice in politics and shaping the future.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act, the Companies’ Creditors Arrangement Act and the Pension Benefits Standards Act, 1985 (pension plans and group insurance plans)
bill_list.header: This legislation aims to prioritize pension fund claims during company bankruptcies, offering greater security for employees' retirement savings but potentially creating challenges for struggling businesses.

bill_list.title: An Act to provide further support in response to COVID-19
bill_list.header: This proposal aims to extend crucial financial support for those impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic, ensuring employees and businesses can continue to thrive as the economy recovers.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Canada Labour Code
bill_list.header: Proposed changes to the Criminal and Labour Codes aim to enhance protections in healthcare and provide extended leave for grieving workers, balancing employee needs with business challenges.

bill_list.title: An Act for granting to Her Majesty certain sums of money for the federal public administration for the fiscal year ending March 31, 2022
bill_list.header: The Appropriation Act No. 4 allocates $8.75 billion for unplanned federal expenses, impacting government employees and taxpayers. It aims to ensure continuous public services but may lead to higher taxes and national debt.

bill_list.title: An Act to develop a national framework for a guaranteed livable basic income
bill_list.header: The National Framework for a Guaranteed Livable Basic Income Act aims to provide financial support to Canadians aged 17 and older, helping those in poverty and facing employment challenges while sparking debate over potential costs and fairness.
bill_list.shortTitle: National Framework for a Guaranteed Livable Basic Income Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (travel expenses deduction for tradespersons)
bill_list.header: A new amendment to the Income Tax Act could help tradespeople deduct travel expenses for jobs far from home, providing financial relief while also raising concerns about government tax revenue.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend certain Acts in relation to survivor pension benefits
bill_list.header: Proposed changes to military and public service pension benefits aim to better support survivors and children of deceased personnel, but raise concerns over financial sustainability and equity among beneficiaries.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (assault against a health care worker)
bill_list.header: This proposed amendment aims to protect healthcare workers from assaults by imposing harsher penalties on offenders, potentially making medical environments safer.

bill_list.title: An Act to enact the Canadian Environmental Bill of Rights and to make related amendments to other Acts
bill_list.header: The Canadian Environmental Bill of Rights strengthens the community's ability to protect their environment by holding corporations and the government accountable for their actions, fostering greater public participation in environmental governance.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Excise Tax Act (psychotherapy services)
bill_list.header: A new amendment proposes to exempt psychotherapy services from GST, aiming to make mental health support more affordable and accessible for everyone.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting the development of a national strategy in relation to fresh water
bill_list.header: The National Freshwater Strategy Act aims to safeguard our vital freshwater resources through an inclusive national approach, addressing climate challenges and ensuring clean drinking water for all communities.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act and to enact the Expungement of Certain Drug-related Convictions Act and the National Strategy on Substance Use Act
bill_list.header: This legislation aims to shift the focus from criminalization to health support for individuals with substance use issues, potentially reshaping law enforcement priorities and increasing access to treatment.
bill_list.shortTitle: Health-based Approach to Substance Use Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canadian Navigable Waters Act (lakes and rivers in British Columbia)
bill_list.header: The proposed amendments to the Canadian Navigable Waters Act aim to expand designated waterways in British Columbia, promoting better access and environmental protection while sparking debates over economic impacts and property rights.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (criminal interest rate)
bill_list.header: This bill aims to protect vulnerable borrowers from predatory lending by redefining interest rates and including additional fees in calculations. While it seeks to create a fairer lending market, it could also limit access to credit for those who need it most.

bill_list.title: An Act to develop a national school food program for children
bill_list.header: The School Food Program for Children Act proposes a national initiative to ensure every child in Canada has access to nutritious food in schools, targeting those who struggle most to obtain it.
bill_list.shortTitle: School Food Program for Children Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Labour Code (bereavement leave)
bill_list.header: Proposed changes to the Canada Labour Code will provide grieving parents with extended leave options after experiencing the loss of a child, stillbirth, or miscarriage, aiming to create a more supportive workplace environment.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Elections Act (voting age)
bill_list.header: The 'Right to Vote at 16 Act' proposes lowering Canada's federal voting age to 16, empowering younger citizens to influence important issues that shape their future. While this could increase civic engagement, it also raises questions about readiness and budget impacts for voter education.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Parliament of Canada Act and to make consequential and related amendments to other Acts
bill_list.header: Proposed changes to the Parliament of Canada Act focus on increasing financial allowances for senators and adjusting their appointment processes. This could impact taxpayers and political parties, creating debates about fairness and government spending.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the House of Commons

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code and the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act and to make consequential amendments to another Act
bill_list.header: Proposed changes to minimum penalties in crimes aim to give judges more discretion, impacting drug offenses and serious crimes, with potential effects on public safety and rehabilitation efforts.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting early learning and child care
bill_list.header: The Early Learning and Child Care Act aims to boost early education across Canada by providing funding while ensuring provinces meet high standards. This initiative could greatly benefit families, especially in Indigenous communities, but raises concerns about potential financial strains and accessibility disparities.
bill_list.shortTitle: Early Learning and Child Care Act

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (conversion therapy)
bill_list.header: This new legislation aims to ban conversion therapy, protecting LGBTQ+ individuals, especially minors, from harmful practices, while also raising questions about its impact on mental health professionals and religious organizations.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Parliament of Canada Act and to make consequential and related amendments to other Acts
bill_list.header: Proposed amendments to the Parliament of Canada Act suggest increasing senator allowances, aiming for better representation and inclusivity. However, this move raises concerns about government spending and public trust during tough economic times.
bill_list.status: Senate bill awaiting first reading in the House of Commons

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canadian Bill of Rights (right to housing)
bill_list.header: This amendment aims to establish the right to proper housing in Canada, ensuring that everyone has access to affordable and adequate living conditions, especially benefiting low- and middle-income families.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the National Defence Act (maiming or injuring self or another)
bill_list.header: This amendment to the National Defence Act changes how mental health issues are treated within the military, promoting a supportive environment for service members while addressing concerns about potential consequences.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Impact Assessment Act
bill_list.header: An amendment to the Impact Assessment Act is changing coal mining regulations, allowing new entrants without production limits, which could impact local economies and environmental safety.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Language Skills Act (Lieutenant Governor of New Brunswick)
bill_list.header: This proposed amendment aims to ensure the Lieutenant Governor must be proficient in both official languages, promoting better communication and inclusivity within government roles in New Brunswick.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Judges Act
bill_list.header: The amendments to the Judges Act aim to overhaul how complaints against judges are handled, boosting accountability while raising concerns about costs and transparency in the judiciary.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting Ukrainian Heritage Month
bill_list.header: The Ukrainian Heritage Month Act aims to celebrate and promote the rich culture of Ukrainian Canadians each September, fostering community engagement and cultural pride while raising questions about inclusivity and resource allocation.

bill_list.title: An Act respecting soil conservation and soil health
bill_list.header: The Soil Conservation Act aims to boost soil health in Canada by engaging farmers, stakeholders, and communities while raising awareness through special observance days. It faces financial challenges but is seen as vital for sustainable agriculture.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code (controlling or coercive conduct)
bill_list.header: This proposed amendment aims to address psychological and coercive abuse in relationships, offering better protection for victims while raising important concerns about enforcement and cost implications.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Income Tax Act (volunteer firefighting and search and rescue volunteer services)
bill_list.header: This amendment proposes to increase tax credits for volunteer firefighters and rescue workers, helping them save on taxes and encouraging community participation.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Constitution Act, 1867 (property qualifications of Senators)
bill_list.header: A new amendment aims to remove financial barriers for Senate candidates in Canada, promoting greater inclusivity and diverse representation in governance.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Constitution Act, 1867 and the Parliament of Canada Act (Speaker of the Senate)
bill_list.header: Proposed changes to how the Senate elects its Speaker and Deputy Speaker aim to enhance accountability and democratize leadership roles through secret ballot elections among senators.

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Department for Women and Gender Equality Act
bill_list.header: This amendment ensures that the effects of government bills on women, particularly Indigenous women, are evaluated and made public, aiming for better representation and more informed legislation.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Governor General’s Act (retiring annuity and other benefits)
bill_list.header: A proposed amendment wants to change retirement benefits for Governor Generals, affecting who qualifies for annuities. While it aims to save taxpayer money, it could discourage potential candidates from stepping up due to the new five-year service requirement.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Languages Skills Act (Governor General)
bill_list.header: The new amendment will require top Canadian officials to be bilingual, aiming to improve inclusivity but potentially limiting diversity and increasing government costs.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Canada Elections Act and the Regulation Adapting the Canada Elections Act for the Purposes of a Referendum (voting age)
bill_list.header: A proposed amendment to the Canada Elections Act seeks to lower the voting age to 16, allowing more young Canadians the chance to shape the future with their votes.
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

bill_list.title: An Act to amend the Customs Tariff (goods from Xinjiang)
bill_list.header: This proposed law seeks to ban the import of goods from China's Xinjiang region due to human rights concerns, affecting consumers and international trade.
bill_list.shortTitle: Xinjiang Manufactured Goods Importation Prohibition Act
bill_list.status: At second reading in the Senate

sample_bill.title: An Act to amend the Criminal Code, to make consequential amendments to other Acts and to repeal a regulation (miscarriage of justice reviews)
sample_bill.header: The Miscarriage of Justice Review Commission Act aims to improve the investigation of wrongful convictions in Canada by creating an independent body, promoting fairness in the justice system.
sample_bill.shortTitle: Miscarriage of Justice Review Commission Act (David and Joyce Milgaard's Law)
